summary: sir bradley wiggins will bid for cycling 's hour record on june 7 at london 's olympic velodrome . the four-time olympic champion and 2012 tour de france winner will attempt to add to his accomplishments by riding the furthest distance in 60 minutes at the lee valley velopark . wiggins finished his team sky career in the paris-roubaix 253.5km one-day race on sunday .

aspect: 1. Sir Bradley Wiggins to attempt cycling's hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome.
2. Four-time Olympic champion and 2012 Tour de France winner aims to add to his accomplishments and motivate people to challenge themselves.

explain: Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break the cycling's hour record at a renowned venue, London's Olympic Velodrome on June 7th. This event marks his final attempt at adding to his extensive list of accomplishments in cycling.

Sir Bradley Wiggins, an accomplished cyclist with four Olympic gold medals and a 2012 Tour de France victory, is attempting to break a cycling record at London's Olympic Velodrome on June 7th. Through this challenge, he aims to motivate people to push themselves and achieve new goals, showcasing his own dedication to continuous improvement.

Bradley Wiggins, a renowned British cyclist, plans to attempt the cycling hour record on June 7th at London's Olympic Velodrome. This challenge will test his endurance as he aims to break the record currently held by Australian rider Rohan Dennis. Wiggins seeks to set a new benchmark in distance achieved within an hour's time, leaving his mark on cycling history for years to come.
